message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.GR, cs.CL, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with deep convolutional networks applied to 3D point clouds, which are commonly used in computer vision and graphics. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also proposes a novel method for computing convolutional kernels, which involves learning weight and density functions, making it relevant to the sub-category cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also deals with geometric data structures, which could place it in the sub-category cs.GR (Computer Graphics). The proposed method is applied to semantic segmentation, which could place it in the sub-category cs.CL (Computation and Language). Finally, the paper proposes a method for converting 2D images into point clouds, which could place it in the sub-category cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence).
